definition: beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: Le Figaro newspaper called the film "faultless".
sentences.chinese: 費加羅報稱讚這部電影“完美無瑕”。

sentences.english: Create prefect and flawless fix effect.
sentences.chinese: 爲你塑造完美無瑕的定妝效果。

sentences.english: I scowled at his perfect face.
sentences.chinese: 我陰沉着臉，瞪着他完美無瑕的面龐。

sentences.english: For now, bide your time and make sure your work is flawless.
sentences.chinese: 現在靜靜的守候同時確保你的工作完美無瑕。

sentences.english: Nature is not perfect and variation within organization leads to greater interest.
sentences.chinese: 大自然並非完美無瑕，自然組織中的差異性更加有趣。

sentences.english: But when everything is all perfect, all the time, it seems like an act.
sentences.chinese: 但是當時時刻刻一切皆完美無瑕，就像是演戲了。

sentences.english: Feyweave armor is woven with techniques perfected by the eladrin.
sentences.chinese: 精織護甲是用雅靈完美無瑕的技術織成。
上帝是一個完美無瑕的父親。

sentences.english: Customer Support? You won't need that. Our programs are flawless.
sentences.chinese: 顧客支援？你不須要此。我們的程式完美無瑕疵。

sentences.english: called Flawless and also Diversity, I think they're called.
sentences.chinese: 他們被稱作完美無瑕和多元化，我想是這樣的名字。

sentences.english: The first throw quad salchow Shen Xue and Zhao Hongbo attempted was flawless.
sentences.chinese: 申雪和越宏博試作的和一個四周拋跳完美無瑕。

definition: original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to be nothing to write home about (idiom)
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
